transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos in) Greetings, you people. I am the Space Ghost. If music be the food of love, then I'm gonna eat lots of the food of love. Why? Because my guests are crooners Pat Boone and Chuck D.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yes?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Do you suffer from:o Inflamationo Chafingo Uncomfortable Redness

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (silence) What?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Don't be embarrassed.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (low voice) What are you talkin' about?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Only the comfort and affordability of Dr. Kwazar's Industrial Ointment.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ointment?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Industrial ointment!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (stares)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: It's good.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hey, Space Ghost, lemme clue you in to the premise of this episode.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Zorak just got his first endorsement deal.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Deal? Let me tell you about a good deal. And a good ointment. (holding up a "Dr. Kwazar's Industrial Ointment" sign) Dr. Kwazar's Industrial Ointment...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah yeah yeah yeah, celebrity endorsement. I remember my first one of those. And, this goes along with the premise.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (blasting a lava alien) Take that, you hot creature! (60's TV commercial music in background) Ah! After I finish off a horde of nasty villains, I like to re-energize with the delicious taste of Sugarman's Potted Meat Food Product. Sugarman's Potted Meat Food Product contains 2% real meat, and meat byproducts. That's right, 2% real meat to go along with superhero-sized portions of sodium nitrate, potassium bicarbonate, pyrodoxine hydrochloride, biotin, cobalt iodate, thiamine mononitrate, thenadiol bisulfite, sodium selenite, D-L-alpha-tocopperal acetate, glucaronalactone, lanacetol, pantothenic acid, and maltodextrin. Ask for Sugarman's. Meat like Grandma used to pot. (smile sparkles) (music ends)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (eating a sandwich) Mmm, mmm, mmm...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I thought they went outta business.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (talking with his mouth full) Yeah, but I got a closet full of this stuff. That's how they paid me. Mmm, ah. Suckers.

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: (on control room monitor, to Moltar) (puts on sunglasses) If I start like this, that would be okay, at some point I'll take 'em off, maybe put 'em back, but that's okay?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: You've obviously given this a lot of thought.

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost might, if he wants to, make some reference to the fact that, uh, they thought they had...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: You're wearing sunglasses?

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: Well, no, he thought they had Pat Boone here, but obviously they got, they've made a mistake, they've got some heavy metal rocker here or something.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Ih.. sure, you can give him that option. But, uh.. lose the gum.

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: (gets rid of his gum) Okay.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: My first guest is my all-time favorite recording artist of all time!

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: (on monitor, lowering from ceiling) I am Pat Boone.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: We need to lose the glasses, Pat.

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: (takes off sunglasses) Oh, well, that could be arranged. Did I shake you up a little bit?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No.

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: (pause) Listen, I am really delighted...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Pat, in 1955 you recorded the monster hit "April Love". Who was your inspiration for that masterpiece?

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: Well, yes, I was influenced, uh, I don't know if you remember the great name Bing Crosby.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Der Bingle!

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: Der Bingle, you're right, hey, you continually amaze me, yes...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's because I'm amazing. Did you know I invented the cotton gin, because I needed a more efficient way to de-seed my cotton bales? And, get this: I've never owned a watch.

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: Good.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Eli Whitney invented the cotton gin!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Lies! Stop with your slanderous lies! Just because you've never done anything, you lazy piece of space garbage! (softly) The look, the feel of cotton! That's all mine!!!

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: It does not surprise me. It really doesn't surprise me.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak, every time you swab your filthy ears, you should fall to your knees and thank me for me and my amazing invention!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Ih, yeah, I'll do that. Pat, do you suffer from inflamation?

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: Boy, I don't know about you space creatures, but Earthlings need lots of fiber.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: It's fiber-licious, Pat.

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: Yeah. Keeps you going good.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Do you use the ointment?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak, a talk show is not the place to promote your personal projects! Boy, scolding Zorak sure builds up a man-sized appetite! I could go for a bowl of pulverized organ mash, basted in sweet intestinal bile fluids. (Then strap on your bib, Space Ghost, and saddle up to a heapin' helpin' of Sugarman's bovine-flavored potted meat! Have a cow, man! A Sugarman cow!)

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: (You certainly, hey, that could be your slogan.)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Who-o-oa. hey Pat, we're readin' each other's heads!)

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: (I know, see, and, and I'm enjoying this.)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey, why are you guys just sittin' there, eh?

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) (Zorak has a tiny brain.)

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: (Yeah, well, maybe you got a point.)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ahem! Do you remember that time at Radio City, I was the one in the third row from the back. You know, the one with the mask and the cape, and I was saying, "Go, Pat. Sing another song." That was a little cheer I made up. Remember that?

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, yeah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Go, Pat. Sing another song.

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: (sings) La la la-a-a, la la la la la la la la-a-a-a!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (grins) Go, Pat. Sing another song.

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: (snapping his fingers, sings) Space Ghost, he's the Space Most. Yes, the Space Ghost. Now see, that's only got one note.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: But the way you sing it, Pat, makes me think it's got at least three.

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: (still snapping) Space Ghost, (ah, ah) he's the Space Most, (Space Ghost begins bouncing in his seat) (ah ah) Yeah, the Space Ghost (ah, ah, ah) he's the Space Ghost. Anyway, we can take it from there, there should probably be at least one other melodic note.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: We should cut that, man. We should go into the studio and lay that bad boy down, right now while the creative juices are still flowin'. Come on, Pat, let's go! (flies off) Pa-a-at!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (bounds back to his desk)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: How'd your session go?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sweet as ice!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh yeah?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I had to punch Pat in the jaw a couple of times, but other than that, I'd say we built a wall of groove!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (pause) Well, let's hear it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Pat's still tinkerin' with the mix. And now, let's mess up the mix, for rap artist Chuck D.

transcript.speaker: Chuck D
transcript.dialogue: (on monitor, lowering from ceiling) Hey, thanks a lot.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Greetings, Chuck ol' buddy.

transcript.speaker: Chuck D
transcript.dialogue: So, Space Ghost, I've been a fan of yours since about 1966, remember?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sighs) 1966.

transcript.speaker: Voice
transcript.dialogue: 1966! (screen fades back to studio)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Those four numerals, placed sequentially, still look the same.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Chuck, do you use the ointment?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I'm just askin'!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Don't answer that, Chuck. My bandleader is wack.

transcript.speaker: Chuck D
transcript.dialogue: There's no such thing as, as anybody being wack, it just means that, you know, you need to work on your stuff a little better.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, he's wack all right. He's a wacky pack!

transcript.speaker: Chuck D
transcript.dialogue: Okay.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I have a rap question.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (glares at Zorak)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Do rappers use the ointment?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay, Zorak, I'm sick of this. Tell us about your amazing ointment, and get it out of your system, so you'll shut up!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: It, um, oh, um, it's, it's, it's good, um, it's, it's, it's good ointment.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Is that it? Are ya done?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: It, uh, it, it makes your skin all creamy and nice. (squirt!) Here, uh, dab some on your face.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Okay, it's, I mean, you don't have to, it's.. your loss, really.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Shut up!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (pause) You know, it's your skin.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Shut up!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (pause) But see, look at my pincers...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: SHUT UP!!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Okay!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hey, Chuck, you wanna run some ball later? I can make a lay-up.

transcript.speaker: Chuck D
transcript.dialogue: I used to dunk when I was in eleventh grade.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I, uh, I have to bounce the ball with both hands.

transcript.speaker: Chuck D
transcript.dialogue: I hear ya, you ever go down to the run and shoot?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uh, no, but one time I blew up a porta-potty.

transcript.speaker: Chuck D
transcript.dialogue: Oh, hey.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I had to change clothes after that.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Now Chuck, my favorite rapper is M. C. Escher.

transcript.speaker: Chuck D
transcript.dialogue: I could tell.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Please, Escher, don't hurt 'em.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey, Chuck, how do you feel about the east coast / west coast beef?

transcript.speaker: Chuck D
transcript.dialogue: East coast / west coast, ah, I just think it's, it's largely fake.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Alright.

transcript.speaker: Chuck D
transcript.dialogue: So don't believe the hype.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Chuck, what's with all the record scratchin'? I mean, records aren't made to take that kind of a beating.

transcript.speaker: Chuck D
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Maybe not, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You like Goody Mo B?

transcript.speaker: Chuck D
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, Goody Mo's the bomb. Now, Goody Mo, Fugees...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Wu Tang!

transcript.speaker: Chuck D
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, Wu Tang, you know, they hittin' near the bottom, I think...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You don't have to talk to Zorak, Chuck. He's not dope or fresh!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: He's askin' some, some pretty good rap questions.

transcript.speaker: Rappin' Space Goblin
transcript.dialogue: Well, I'm the Space Goblin, and I'm here to sayThat stayin' in school is A-okay.If you wanna good job, and you wanna do right,Then stay in school... it's outta sight.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, look, everyone, it's the Rappin' Space Goblin, here to do us a "solid", by providing some valuable information for you kids out there. Let's listen...

transcript.speaker: Rappin' Space Goblin
transcript.dialogue: Well, I'm the Space Goblin, and I'm here to sayThat if you're crossin' the street, you best look both ways.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Say, Chuck, would you care to break some rhymes with the Space Goblin?

transcript.speaker: Chuck D
transcript.dialogue: (shakes his head) Nah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Your loss. Rappin' Space Goblin, what's the "word" on the street regarding a healthy diet?

transcript.speaker: Rappin' Space Goblin
transcript.dialogue: We-e-e-e-ell, I'm the Space Goblin, and I'm here to sayThat eatin' vegetables is A-okay.Like - Arrggghh! (gets blasted by Zorak)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (holding his blast rifle) Aah, 'ere we go.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak, you have destroyed an important educational tool.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: So?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And a dear friend. (aims power band and blasts Zorak)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Aaaagh!

transcript.speaker: Chuck D
transcript.dialogue: Everything is cool, everything's peace in here, right?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah yeah yeah yeah. And now, let's listen to Mr. Pat Boone and I performing my new hit single, "Space Ghost, He's the Space Most".

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost!

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: He's the Space Most.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm the Space Ghost!

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: Yes, the Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost!

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: He's the Space Most.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: He's the Space Most!

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: Yes, the Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost!

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: Ah. Ah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You know the words!

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: He's the Space Most. Ah. Ah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm the Space Most!

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, the Space Ghost. Ah. Ah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah! The Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: He's the Space Most.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm the Space Most!

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: Yes, the Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's me!

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: He's the Space Most.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm the one!

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: Yes, the Space Ghost. Ah. Ah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost!

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: He's the Space Most. Ah. Ah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Come on!

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, the Space Ghost. Ah. Ah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah! The Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Pat Boone
transcript.dialogue: La la la-a-a, la la la la la la la la-a-a-a!
